Subject: Re: [junit] Debugging a test method with JUnit 3.5 and JBuilder 4.0

From: Tod Landis <tlandis@...>

Are you setting a breakpoint on a line of code or on an exception?  Here's
why I ask...

If you copy an exception eg. junit.framework.AssertionFailedError, from the
JBuilder message area into the "Run | Add Exception Breakpoint" dialog it is
possible to pick up a carriage return at the end of the exception name (You
can tell if this happened by looking at the Run | View Breakpoints list--the
CR will show up as a funny character at the end of the class name)      JB
won't break for the exception you wanted if it has the extra CR.  To avoid
the problem, go to the end of the class name and backspace once to zap the
carriage return.

Tod Landis




Joi Ellis wrote:

> On Wed, 14 Mar 2001, Michael wrote:
>
> > I found a couple others have this same problem (the debugger doesn't
> > stop at the breakpoint) and I haven't found a solution.  I tried the -
> > noloading option but that didn't make a difference either.  Is there
> > a solution for this?
> >
> > Micha�l
>
> Are you running the debug session with -classic in the VM parameters?
> HotSpot has several bugs in its debugger support.
>
> --
